metadata.titel_preek: The Line Runs through Each Person

locutie.beschrijving: A comprehensive exploration of the cosmic and internal battle between good and evil, utilizing historical, literary (C.S. Lewis), and biblical metaphors of 'occupied territory' and 'D-Day vs V-E Day'.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher integrates Pauline theology (Rom 7) with apocalyptic imagery and narrative Old Testament texts.

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon moves from asserting the reality of evil to declaring the victory of Christ, culminating in a call to surrender (enlistment).
voorbeelden: Tonight and tomorrow, you get an opportunity to enlist in God’s army.
The line between good and evil runs through each person.
Will you lay down your arms tonight?

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Conviction of sin (shattering denial) and comfort through the 'retroactive' grace of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly acknowledged in the closing prayer: 'by the power of your Holy Spirit they are made acceptable'.

voorbeelden: The line between good and evil runs through each person.
Satan has been at work setting in motion the terrible events.
The world is God’s good creation.
Give yourself a pat on the back.
Let each person present think upon his or her own situation.
Put on the whole armor of God.
I do not understand my own actions.
The promise of God is that we sinners will not only be forgiven, we will be justified.
He will take those weapons of self-destruction away from you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological grounding, but often framed as 'The promise is...' (Assertive about a Commissive) rather than 'I promise you' (Direct Commissive).

voorbeelden: There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
This is the announcement of God’s good news.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies heavily on Scriptural citation to carry the declarative weight.

indicatoren: Extensive use of illustrations (C.S. Lewis, Poland, 60 Minutes, Ford, Hollywood).
Long sections 'talking about' the nature of evil as a concept.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually convinced, but the 'event' of the Word is delayed until the final third.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of waiting for the 'point' or the 'call' through the narrative build-up.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological quality, specifically the 'retroactive grace' concept.
voorbeelden: The promise of God is that we sinners will not only be forgiven, we will be justified.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly challenging the hearer's denial and calling for surrender.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used heavily in the final 'tent meeting' appeal.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a panoramic view of the cosmic battle, which can feel like a lecture.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about sin and the line through the heart.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Now' of the tent meeting and the cross.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Nature of Evil) -> Declarative (Christ's Victory) -> Commissive (God's promise of help) -> Directive (Lay down arms).
voorbeelden: The line runs through each person... Christ became a curse for us... He will take those weapons... Will you lay down your arms?
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The movement is logically and theologically sound, avoiding moralism.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because Christ has absorbed the judgment, there is now no condemnation... therefore, lay down your arms.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a high constative load, the sermon successfully pivots into a performative event by the end, using the 'tent meeting' context to force a 'now' moment.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The line between good and evil runs through each person.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on Ford engines and Hollywood.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Risk of losing the 'kerygmatic' edge in social commentary.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it moves from 'talking about' evil to 'addressing' the hearer at the foot of the cross.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of the General Confession and the direct address 'Will you lay down your arms?' functions as a means of grace.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, especially in the final appeal.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strongly evident in the prayer: 'let them know it is really you and not any human preacher'.
tekstueel_bewijs: God is going to do it for you.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, in the perlocutionary hope of the prayer.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher explicitly asks the Spirit to make the words acceptable.
tekstueel_bewijs: by the power of your Holy Spirit they are made acceptable

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as an 'invasion' of the Word into the hearer's life.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: High, particularly in the description of the cross.
tekstueel_bewijs: Now he enters his last battle.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 3rd person descriptive verbs to 2nd person performative verbs earlier in the text.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The promise of God is that we sinners will not only be forgiven...
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of Jesus Christ, I promise you: you are forgiven and justified.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a description of a promise to the act of promising.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often 'reported' rather than 'bestowed'.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more 'I' (as God's ambassador) to 'You' language.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you today: the ruler of this world is cast out of your life.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Maintain the strong 'we' to 'you' transition used in the final section.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using narrative to build toward a sacramental moment of surrender.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the 'appeal' or 'self-revelation' of the preacher; SAT reveals this is not an appeal to the will but a creative word that 'takes the weapons away'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: It is not just 'persuading' the audience that evil is real, but 'performing' the victory of Christ through the proclamation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'tent meeting' context provides the felicity conditions for the performative 'Will you lay down your arms?' to succeed.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The line between good and evil runs through each person.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - creates the necessary crisis for grace.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God is going to do it for you.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The turning point of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon balances a very high intellectual/constative load with a deeply performative ending.
